Yeah true, this along with the new creative menu and furnace controls are all trash.
I love building stuff but without insta-break blocks, it's very annoying. Everything else I've found is ok

I have played the game since I was like 4 years old but I don't actually know when I started when they updated the controls at first I was fine with it but now I just tried playing with the new d-pad and saw that they had changed it I hated it.
The old controls are easier to use the the new ones
The controls are to far from the side so my issue is that I keep hitting instead of moving, so it all together harder to move please give the old controls back
I completely agree.

I think that new players will not care, or even notice that it has changed, but for anyone who has played on mobile for more than a year will find the new controls annoying. I have almost 6000 hours played on my tablet, and over 800 worlds. The old controls are what I know and what I remember. These new controls have such large gaps between the buttons, I sometimes miss them and start breaking my builds (creative mode). I started speedrunning not long ago and I haven't gotten a personal best since these new controls. It also affects my combat skills too, as I sometimes miss the buttons due to muscle memory.

Sorry I am a non native English speaking player so use the translation. Please include the mistakes.

Since the update to 1.20.73, the control difficulty has increased significantly. The device I use is the iPad Pro third generation (11inch). In the latest version, when I use the touch screen, my finger is extremely easily pointed to the blank space, causing my operation (always) to be interrupted. I updated the version the day before, and I was sized for 3 days to achieve precise control, but it turned out that I couldn't do it.
My appeal is the same as you. I suggest the official version selection of the operation. Let the player choose whether to use the new version of the operation, or as in the past.
Finally, to express my feelings: I am a Chinese player, a company agent Minecraft the actual situation of all players are very clear. That's why I bought the Minecraft International for dollars. I don't want the international version of my world to start getting less good as well. Please cherish every hard around the many obstacles, firmly support the international version of the Chinese players
Mojang team, if you see this comment, will you add offhand

Yeah I also want this. And mojang if you are worried about space on small devices then you can give the feature of sneak to use off hand item just as we use shields. When players have to use the main hand they will not sneak and when the player have to use item in off hand they could just sneak and use it

But mojang please please please bring off hand support

I agree, I would really like to see this in the game.
For the problem of controls, I think, for console users, the offhand should be used instead of main hand when you build or break things, IF you are holding down D-PAD UP.
For mobile, there should be extra buttons for the offhand.
For connected keyboards... I don't know cause I don't use one, so maybe just use the same layout Java uses.
Please mojang off hand la dooo please üôèüèªü•∫
I completely agree, except this change has made me doubt and criticize every new change Mojang makes.
Agreed, I'd make it an option you can toggle to.
YES PLEASE!!!!! i won‚Äôt be playing again until this gets fixed
Thank for letting us know! What is it about the size that has changed on your device? /Unn @ Mojang
LISTEN TO YOUR FEEDBACK MOJANG!! so many players (including me) are quitting because of this - which is ridiculous since it could be fixed by you so easily.

changing the size is extremely difficult because there‚Äôs certain ‚Äúparameters‚Äù (on the bottom and such) so that i can‚Äôt move the dpad to its original position. the backwards button used to be all the way set to the bottom but now it can‚Äôt be moved there.
I agree!
The buttons are so tiny yet the direction pad has been moved so far in, no physical person has a thumb that long and yet that tiny to use the tiny buttons.
The sprinting thing would be very helpful for parkour.

1) turn on auto sprint, it makes the players sprint if you move the joystick a little more forward.

2) you can't use the action buttons on "joystick and tap to interact" since you would need to use a crosshair for that

 

otherwise, great ideas!

1) Unfortunately you need to push the thumb far away on such a large joystick to auto-sprint. I hope there's ways to customize the joystick size, position, and input AOE, where the joystick can get pushed even if your thumb's slightly outside of the button.

Also, I just hope that if I choose the sprint button, it stays ON until I press it again to toggle off. It keeps turning off when I release the joystick, leading to deaths.

2) Yes, and we can assume a crosshair on the "joystick & tap to interact" mode. Some actions like bucket-fishing and crossbows are extremely difficult without action buttons, but the third no-tap crosshair mode makes building etc difficult as well. We need to combine the best of both!

I'd also like to add how getting furnace items are extremely slow as well, you need to tap 64 times to get 64 iron and there's no take-all button on furnaces, or craft-all button for crafting. Hopefully that can be changed in the future!

It seems it's possible to change joystick position/size in 1.20, but it's kinda hidden. There's no way to change joystick AOE though. I could make a small joystick to allow an easy auto-sprint top-speed without straining my thumb, but if I release the joystick & try to press it again, my thumb often miss the small joystick & my character ends up looking around or tapping something. Ideally I'd like a tiny joystick with big input AOE, it's common in mobile games to get top speed quickly. Alternatively, a large joystick with small "deadzone" can allow it to reach max speed easily without pushing it far.

To put it simply, I just want my character to easily sprint without having to strain my thumb, and I want the joystick to be large enough such that it's unmissable by my thumb. But if I make it big, I unfortunately have to strain my thumb to reach top speed.

I've noticed several glitches on the d-pad buttons mode:

If you increase jump button size, then enter water, your controls will revert to default, because the big jump button overlaps the up-down swim buttons that suddenly appear.

And if you go to shallow 1-block water with d-pad controls, the up-down swim button appears, but if you hold "up" to get out of water, you'll swim up but the button disappears & reappears, so by holding the "up" button your character will end up breaking a block, etc. You'll have trouble getting out of water. Compare this with the joystick mode's swim-up button & you'll see the difference.
I agree that Sprint should be a toggle on/off - as it stands the current configuration makes SoulSteel almost unplayable (you need to sprint double-jump).

Note: This post was slightly similar to another post submitted by a user on jan, 27, but I wanted to cover a couple of additional topics that weren‚Äôt covered in that post, such as mainly the suggestions for the control customization menu. Also the post may seem a bit chunky/weirdly worded, but that‚Äôs mainly from being pressured by character limits. I also want to note that in point number 1, I understand that the borders around the screen are there to prohibit controls from going off screen, but the reset to default button already completes that function.
yes i accept this vote.

And size of the controls for flight are also smaller and cannot change size which is annoying. They are also stuck in the original positioning and won‚Äôt move or change size with the fly/jump button

Yes!!! I would love to the old pad back, all my muscle memory of 8 years it useless now. It makes it harder to play and overall makes me not in the mood to play Minecraft anymore. I agree that we should have the option to use the new pad or the classic instead of totally ditching the old one!!
